news_header: Reddit has signed contracts with AI companies to train AI using user-generated messages, reporting significant profits and increased visitor numbers.
news_text: Reddit, founded in 2005, has signed contracts with AI companies allowing them to train AI on user-generated content. The company reported a profit of $29.9 million for Q3, with net sales rising to $348.4 million, a 68% increase from the previous year. Despite challenges from social media competition, Reddit remains one of the top ten most visited websites globally, driven by increased visitors and advertising revenue, which reached $315.1 million. Google pays $60 million annually for access to Reddit's user-generated text. Reddit went public on the New York Stock Exchange in March to enhance revenue.
